module.name: FileUtil
module.short: Miscellaneous procedures and functions for manipulating files and filenames

element.name: CompareFilenames
element.short: CompareFileNames - compares two file names to see whether they are equal

element.name: CompareFilenames.Result
element.short: Returns zero if files are equal, or the index of differences, or the difference in length if filenames are not equal

element.name: CompareFilenames.Filename1
element.short: First filename

element.name: CompareFilenames.Filename2
element.short: Second filename

element.name: CompareFilenames.ResolveLinks
element.short: ResolveLinks - if True, searches through links to find the actual file for comparison

element.name: CompareFilenames.Len1
element.short: Length of first filename

element.name: CompareFilenames.Len2
element.short: Length of second filename

element.name: FilenameIsAbsolute
element.short: Checks whether an absolute file name is given in TheFileName

descr.p: Checks whether an absolute file name is given in TheFileName
Makes use of FilenameIsWinAbsolute on Windows systems, otherwise uses FilenameIsUnixAbsolute

element.name: FilenameIsAbsolute.Result
element.short: Returns True if an absolute filename has been supplied

element.name: FilenameIsAbsolute.TheFilename
element.short: The name of the file to be checked

element.name: FilenameIsWinAbsolute
element.short: FilenameIsWinAbsolute - checks that the supplied name is an absolute file name for the Windows system

descr.p: FilenameIsWinAbsolute - checks that the supplied name is an absolute file name for the Windows system
Looks, for instance, for Drive Letters and colon at the beginning of the string

element.name: FilenameIsWinAbsolute.Result
element.short: Returns True if this is a true absolite Windows filename

element.name: FilenameIsWinAbsolute.TheFilename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: FilenameIsUnixAbsolute
element.short: FilenameIsUnixAbsolute - checks that the supplied name is an absolute filename in Unix systems

descr.p: FilenameIsUnixAbsolute - checks that the supplied name is an absolute filename in Unix systems
Checks that the name is non-empty and starts with a slash

element.name: FilenameIsUnixAbsolute.Result
element.short: Returns True if the supplied name is a correct Absolute file name for a Unix system

element.name: FilenameIsUnixAbsolute.TheFilename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: CheckIfFileIsExecutable
element.short: CheckIfFileIsExecutable - creates Exception if file is not Executable

descr.p: CheckIfFileIsExecutable - creates Exception if file is not Executable
Otherwise, there is no action

element.errors: An exception is raised if the file is not executable

element.name: CheckIfFileIsExecutable.AFilename
element.short: AFileName - name of the file for checking

element.name: CheckIfFileIsSymlink
element.short: CheckIfFileIsSymlink - raises an exception if file is not a Symbolic Link

descr.p: CheckIfFileIsSymlink - raises an exception if file is not a Symbolic Link
Otherwise no action

element.errors: An exception is raised with appropriate message if file does not exist or is not a correct symbolic link (eg dangling link, circular link, read access denied, or not a symbolic link)

element.name: CheckIfFileIsSymlink.AFilename
element.short: AFileName - name of file for checking

element.name: FileIsReadable
element.short: FileIsReadable - checks whether supplied file name refers to a readable file

descr.p: FileIsReadable - checks whether supplied file name refers to a readable file
Always true on Windows systems.
On Unix systems, checks permissions of file

element.name: FileIsReadable.Result
element.short: Always true in Windows; in Unix systems, returns true if read permission exists for the file

element.name: FileIsReadable.AFilename
element.short: Name of the file for checking

element.name: FileIsWritable
element.short: FileIsWritable - checks if the supplied file name refers to a file that is writable

descr.p: FileIsWritable - checks if the supplied file name refers to a file that is writable
Checks file permissions in both Unix and Windows systems

element.name: FileIsWritable.Result
element.short: Returns True if Write permission exists

element.name: FileIsWritable.AFilename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: FileIsText
element.short: FileIsText - checks whether the supplied file name refers to a readable text file

descr.p: FileIsText - checks whether the supplied file name refers to a readable text file
Searches the opening section of the file (first 1024 characters) for non-text characters such as ASCII 0 to 31 (except CR and LF, the new line characters)

element.errors: If there is a file reading error, an Exception is raised and FileReadable returns False

element.name: FileIsText.Result
element.short: Returns True if the file is a text file

element.name: FileIsText.AFilename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: FileIsText.FileReadable
element.short: Returns false if a file reading Exception is encountered

element.name: FileIsExecutable
element.short:
FileIsExecutable - checks if
AFileName refers to an executable file

descr.p:
FileIsExecutable - checks if
AFileName refers to an executable file
On Windows systems, if the file exists it is regarded as executable.
On other systems (eg Unix etc), looks at file permissions to see whether execute flag is set

element.name: FileIsExecutable.Result
element.short: Returns True if file is executable (always true in Windows if file exists)

element.name: FileIsExecutable.AFilename
element.short: Name of the file for checking

element.name: FileIsSymlink
element.short: FileIsSymLink - check if file name is a symbolic link

descr.p: FileIsSymLink - check if file name is a symbolic link
On Windows systems, always returns false. On others, returns true if it is a symbolic link

element.name: FileIsSymlink.Result
element.short: Returns True if file name is a symbolic link (always false in Windows systems)

element.name: FileIsSymlink.AFilename
element.short: Name of the file for checking

element.name: FileSize
element.short: FileSize - finds the size of the named file

element.name: FileSize.Result
element.short: Returns the size of the file, or -1 if not there

element.name: FileSize.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: GetFileDescription
element.short: GetFileDescription - finds the Unix-type file description for the given file

descr.p: GetFileDescription - finds the Unix-type file description for the given file
No action in Windows systems (returns empty string)

element.name: GetFileDescription.Result
element.short: Returns empty string (Windows) or Unix-type file description string in other systems

element.name: GetFileDescription.AFilename
element.short: The name of the file whose description is sought

element.name: ReadAllLinks
element.short:
ReadAllLinks - tries to find the file that is referred to by the symbolic link in
FileName

descr.p:
ReadAllLinks - tries to find the file that is referred to by the symbolic link in
FileName

p.var: On Unix-like systems, finds the linked file and returns its full path and filename, or (if ExceptionOnError has been set True) an Exception is raised with appropriate error message

element.errors: If an error is encountered on trying to read the link, provided ExceptionOnError has been set True an Exception is raised with appropriate error message. Otherwise an error results in the return of an empty string.

element.name: ReadAllLinks.Result
element.short: Returns the full path and filename of the target file; empty if the file is not found, or the original FileName on Windows systems

element.name: ReadAllLinks.Filename
element.short: The string containing the symbolic link

element.name: ReadAllLinks.ExceptionOnError
element.short: If True, an Exception is raised on encountering a file error

element.name: DirPathExists
element.short: Checks if the given directory path exists

element.name: DirPathExists.Result
element.short: Returns True if the given directory path exists

element.name: DirPathExists.FileName
element.short: Name of the directory path to be checked

element.name: ForceDirectory
element.short: ForceDirectory - creates a directory if none exists

element.name: ForceDirectory.Result
element.short: Returns True if successfully created directory

element.name: ForceDirectory.DirectoryName
element.short: The name of the directory required

element.name: DeleteDirectory
element.short:
DeleteDirectory - Delete the named directory (or only its contents if
OnlyChilds is True)
element.errors: If there was an error, such as trying to removing . or .., or there were insufficient permissions, or the file did not exist, False is returned

element.name: DeleteDirectory.Result
element.short: Returns True if the directory or its contents were correctly removed

element.name: DeleteDirectory.DirectoryName
element.short: The name of the directory for processing

element.name: DeleteDirectory.OnlyChilds
element.short: If True, only the contents ('children') of the directory are removed

element.name: ProgramDirectory
element.short: ProgramDirectory - returns the directory in which the currently running program resides

element.name: ProgramDirectory.Result
element.short: Returns the name of the directory in which the current program is found

element.name: DirectoryIsWritable
element.short: DirectoryIsWritable - checks if it is possible to write a file to the named directory

descr.p: DirectoryIsWritable - checks if it is possible to write a file to the named directory
Tries to create a text file within the named directory, and write to it. Returns True if it works, and False if it doesn't. Also raises an Exception on failure

element.errors: An Exception is raised on failure to create or write to the temporary file

element.name: DirectoryIsWritable.Result
element.short: Returns True if successful in writing a temporary file to the named directory

element.name: DirectoryIsWritable.DirectoryName
element.short: Name of the Directory for checking

element.name: PascalFileExt
element.short: PascalFileExt - typically '.pas', '.pp' or '.p'

element.name: ExtractFileNameOnly
element.short: ExtractFileNameOnly - removes all path delimiters and file extensions, leaving just the file name

element.name: ExtractFileNameOnly.Result
element.short: Returns the original file name with path delimiters and the extension removed

element.name: ExtractFileNameOnly.AFilename
element.short: The name of the file for processing

element.name: ExtractFileNameWithoutExt
element.short: ExtractFileNameWithoutExt - returns just the name of the file without an extension

element.name: ExtractFileNameWithoutExt.Result
element.short: Returns the original file name if it had no extension, otherwise returns the file name with its extension removed

element.name: ExtractFileNameWithoutExt.AFilename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: CompareFileExt
element.short: CompareFileExt - see whether the nominated file has an extension that is the same as the supplied extension

element.name: CompareFileExt.Result
element.short: Returns zero if extension is present in file name, otherwise returns non-zero value

element.name: CompareFileExt.Filename
element.short: The FileName whose extension is to be checked

element.name: CompareFileExt.Ext
element.short: Ext - string defining the Extension to be checked

element.name: CompareFileExt.CaseSensitive
element.short:
CaseSensitive - if True, case of
Ext must match case in
FileName

element.name: FilenameIsPascalUnit
element.short: FilenameIsPascalUnit - checks that the supplied name is a correct Pascal unit name

descr.p: FilenameIsPascalUnit - checks that the supplied name is a correct Pascal unit name
Looks at the file extension to see if it matches one of the standard Pascal extensions (currently .p, .pp, .pas)

element.name: FilenameIsPascalUnit.Result
element.short: Returns True if the supplied name is a correct Pascal Unit filename

element.name: FilenameIsPascalUnit.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: AppendPathDelim
element.short: Appends the path delimeter to the path.
element.descr: AppendPathDelim checks if the last character in the path is the path delimeter. If it isn't the path delimeter, it is added, otherwise the unmodified path is returned.

element.name: AppendPathDelim.Result
element.short: Returns a new path name including delimiter, if it was not already there, otherwise returns original pathname

element.name: AppendPathDelim.Path
element.short: Path - name for checking

element.name: ChompPathDelim
element.short: Removes trailing path delimeter
element.descr: ChompPathDelim checks if the last character in the path is the path delimeter. If it is the path delimeter, it is removed, otherwise the unmodified path is returned.

element.name: ChompPathDelim.Result
element.short: Returns new path name with delimiter removed if it was there, otherwise returns original path name

element.name: ChompPathDelim.Path
element.short: Path name for checking

element.name: TrimFilename
element.short: TrimFilename - trim double path delimiters, heading and trailing spaces and special dirs . and ..

element.name: TrimFilename.Result
element.short: Returns the original file name if no trimming was needed, otherwise returns the trimmed file name

element.name: TrimFilename.AFilename
element.short: The name of the file for trimming

element.name: CleanAndExpandFilename
element.short: CleanAndExpandFilename - trims irrelevant characters such as path delimiters from the name of the file

element.name: CleanAndExpandFilename.Result
element.short: Returns the original file name without redundant leading or trailing spaces, path delimiters etc

element.name: CleanAndExpandFilename.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for processing

element.name: CleanAndExpandDirectory
element.short:
CleanAndExpandDirectory - trims and cleans
FileName and appends a directory delimiter to it

element.name: CleanAndExpandDirectory.Result
element.short: Returns the cleaned file name with appended directory delimiter

element.name: CleanAndExpandDirectory.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for operation

element.name: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath
element.short:
CreateAbsoluteSearchPath - concatenates
BaseDirectory and
SearchPath to form an absolute path to search for files

descr.p:
CreateAbsoluteSearchPath - concatenates
BaseDirectory and
SearchPath to form an absolute path to search for files

Adds appropriate path delimiters to the BaseDirectory string, then adds the search path, checking that each directory in the path is in fact an absolutely specified directory, then returns the fully formed absolute search path.

element.errors: If BaseDirectory is empty, functions exits and returns with Result equal to SearchPath; if SearchPath is empty, function exits with empty Result

element.name: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath.Result
element.short: The absolute path formed by concatenating BaseDirectory and SearchPath

element.name: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath.SearchPath
element.short: The search path (a relative path)

element.name: CreateAbsoluteSearchPath.BaseDirectory
element.short: The base directory from which to form the absolute path

element.name: CreateRelativePath
element.short: CreateRelativePath - given an absolute file path and aBaseDirectory, create a file path relative to the given base directory

descr.p: CreateRelativePath - given an absolute path and a BaseDirectory, create a file path relative to the given base directory

The returned string includes the correct number of dots and double dots to signify relativity to the current directory (eg ../../or ..\..\ etc). The inverse operation is to create an absolute file path:

element.errors: If BaseDirectory is empty, functions exits and returns with Result equal to Filename; if Filename is empty, function exits with empty Result

element.name: CreateRelativePath.Result
element.short: The file name expressed as path relative to the current directory

element.name: CreateRelativePath.Filename
element.short: The absolute FileName for which a relative path is to be created

element.name: CreateRelativePath.BaseDirectory
element.short: BaseDirectory of the absolute search path

element.name: FileIsInPath
element.short:
FileIsInPath - checks that
FileName refers to a file that exists within the given
Path

element.name: FileIsInPath.Result
element.short: Returns True if a file named Filename exists within the given Path

element.name: FileIsInPath.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: FileIsInPath.Path
element.short: The Path to be searched

element.name: FileIsInDirectory
element.short:
FileIsInDirectory - checks whether a file with
FileName exists within the given
Directory

descr.p:
FileIsInDirectory - checks whether a file with
FileName exists within the given
Directory

element.name: FileIsInDirectory.Result
element.short: Returns True if the file is in the directory

element.name: FileIsInDirectory.Filename
element.short: The name of the file to be checked

element.name: FileIsInDirectory.Directory
element.short: The name of the directory to be searched for the file

element.name: AllDirectoryEntriesMask
element.short: AllDirectoryEntriesMask - typically '*' on most systems

element.name: GetAllFilesMask
element.short: File mask representing all files suitable for showing in a file filter.
element.descr:
GetAllFilesMask returns a File Mask suitable for showing in a filter of a Open File Dialog.
windows '*.*' is returned, on other operating systems just '*'.

element.name: GetExeExt
element.short: GetExeExt - find the correct extension for an executable file

element.name: GetExeExt.Result
element.short: Returns '.exe' in Windows, nothing in other systems

element.name: SearchFileInPath
element.short: SearchFileInPath - searches for Filename in the given SearchPath using the supplied BasePath with the specified Delimiter and the options listed in Flags

descr.p: Searches the whole path unless the sffDontSearchInBasePath flag is present
Returns the first file that matches the supplied criteria

element.errors: If the file does not exist, an empty string is returned

element.name: SearchFileInPath.Result
element.short: Returns fully specified file name of the first file that matches the supplied criteria, or empty string if file not found

element.name: SearchFileInPath.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for searching

element.name: SearchFileInPath.BasePath
element.short: The BasePath to be used for the search

element.name: SearchFileInPath.SearchPath
element.short: The path for searching

element.name: SearchFileInPath.Delimiter
element.short: The directory Delimiter to be used in the search

element.name: SearchFileInPath.Flags
element.short: Flags specifying how to search: e.g. don't search in base path, case independent search

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath
element.short: SearchAllFilesInPath - searches for all files named Filename in the given SearchPath using the supplied BasePath with the specified Delimiter and the options listed in Flags

descr.p: Searches the whole path unless the sffDontSearchInBasePath flag is present
Returns all files that match the supplied criteria

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.Result
element.short: Returns fully specified file names of all files that match the supplied criteria, or empty string if file not found

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for searching

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.BasePath
element.short: The BasePath to be used for the search

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.SearchPath
element.short: The path for searching

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.Delimiter
element.short: The directory Delimiter to be used in the search

element.name: SearchAllFilesInPath.Flags
element.short: Flags specifying how to search: e.g. don't search in base path, case independent search

element.name: FindDiskFilename
element.short: FindDiskFilename - finds the file that best fits the supplied filename

descr.p: FindDiskFilename - finds the file that best fits the supplied filename
Searches for the filename case on disk. The file must exist.
For example: If Filename='file' and there is only a 'File' then 'File' will be returned.

element.name: FindDiskFilename.Result
element.short: Returns the best fitting filename from the disk (taking case into consideration)

element.name: FindDiskFilename.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for checking

element.name: FindDiskFileCaseInsensitive
element.short:
FindDiskFileCaseInsensitive - searches for the given
FileName in a case insensitive manner

element.name: FindDiskFileCaseInsensitive.Result
element.short: If it exists, returns the file name with path information otherwise returns an empty string

element.name: FindDiskFileCaseInsensitive.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for processing

element.name: FindDefaultExecutablePath
element.short: FindDefaultExecutablePath - finds the default path to the named Executable file

descr.p: FindDefaultExecutablePath - finds the default path to the named Executable file
On Windows systems, looks for the '.EXE' extension
In all systems, searches the 'PATH' environment variable to see if the file is in one of the default paths

element.name: FindDefaultExecutablePath.Result
element.short: Returns the filename of the Executable file with path information attached

element.name: FindDefaultExecutablePath.Executable
element.short: The name of the Executable file

element.name: TFileIterator
element.short: Class for getting info about found file or directory.

element.name: TFileIterator.Stop
element.short: Stops the searching process.

element.name: TFileIterator.IsDirectory
element.short: If the current file is directory.

element.name: TFileIterator.FileName
element.short: Gets the current file name.

element.name: TFileIterator.FileInfo
element.short: Gets the current file info.

element.name: TFileIterator.Level
element.short: Gets the current file path level relative to base search path.

element.name: TFileIterator.Path
element.short: Gets the current file path.

element.name: TFileIterator.Searching
element.short: If the searching is in process.

element.name: TFileSearcher
element.short: Class for searching files.

element.name: TFileSearcher.Create
element.short: Creates new file searcher object.

element.name: TFileSearcher.Search
element.short: Searches for files in specified path with passed options.
element.descr: Searches for files in specified path. When file is found the OnFileFound event is invoked, for directories OnDirectoryFound event. You can abort searching process by calling Stop method in this events.

element.name: TFileSearcher.Search.ASearchPath
element.short: Base path for searching files.

element.name: TFileSearcher.Search.ASearchMask
element.short: Mask which file should match.

element.name: TFileSearcher.Search.ASearchSubDirs
element.short: If search recursively sub directories.

element.name: TFileSearcher.OnDirectoryFound
element.short: Is invoked when directory is found.

element.name: TFileSearcher.OnFileFound
element.short: Is invoked when file is found.

element.name: FindAllFiles
element.short: Returns the list of found files in the specified path according to passed options.

element.name: FindAllFiles.Result
element.short: List of found files.

element.name: FindAllFiles.SearchPath
element.short: Base path for searching files.

element.name: FindAllFiles.SearchMask
element.short: Mask which file should match.

element.name: FindAllFiles.SearchSubDirs
element.short: If search recursively sub directories.

element.name: ReadFileToString
element.short: ReadFileToString - returns a string with the contents of the named file

descr.p: Opens the file and reads its contents into a Stream, then reads the stream to construct the Result string

element.errors: If there is an error in reading the file, an exception is raised and an empty string is returned

element.name: ReadFileToString.Result
element.short: The contents of the file as a string, or an empty string if there is an error or the file is empty

element.name: ReadFileToString.Filename
element.short: The name of the file for processing

element.name: CopyFile
element.short: CopyFile - copies Source file to Destination file, optionally preserving the time stamp of the original file
element.errors: An exception is raised if the Copy process does not complete successfully or correctly

element.name: CopyFile.Result
element.short: Returns True if successful, False if there was an error

element.name: CopyFile.SrcFilename
element.short: The source filename for the Copy

element.name: CopyFile.DestFilename
element.short: The destination filename for the Copy

element.name: CopyFile.PreserveTime
element.short: If True, the time stamp of the original file is preserved in the copied file

element.name: GetTempFilename
element.short: GetTempFilename - finds a suitable name for a temporary file

descr.p: GetTempFilename - finds a suitable name for a temporary file

p.var: Uses Prefix plus an integer to generate a file with extension '.tmp' in the specified Directory; if it already exists, increments the integer until it finds a name that is not already used

element.name: GetTempFilename.Result
element.short: Returns the temporary file name that has been created

element.name: GetTempFilename.Directory
element.short: The Directory in which the temprary file is to be placed

element.name: GetTempFilename.Prefix
element.short: The Prefix to which an integer will be attached to generate a temporary filename
